channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A Minnesota gun safety expert weighs in on the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rob Doar, president of the Minnesota Gun Owners Law Center, on his viewing of and reaction to the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rob Doar, president of the Minnesota Gun Owners Law Center, on his viewing of and reaction to the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: When a loved one with dementia wanders away
item.description: Caregivers of people with dementia often reach their breaking point when their loved one wanders off alone. How "elopement" can lead to institutional care.
item.content:encoded: Caregivers of people with dementia often reach their breaking point when their loved one wanders off alone. How "elopement" can lead to institutional care.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Milne-Tyte

item.title: Why 'Vigil' author George Saunders often revisits death in his work
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with author George Saunders on his latest novel Vigil, and why he finds himself revisiting death in his work.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with author George Saunders on his latest novel Vigil, and why he finds himself revisiting death in his work.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Fourth graders ask whether kids or adults have it better as part of NPR challenge
item.description: Who's got it better in life, kids or adults? A group of fourth-graders in New Jersey did some serious reporting on this topic and sent us their findings as a part of NPR's Student Podcast Challenge.
item.content:encoded: Who's got it better in life, kids or adults? A group of fourth-graders in New Jersey did some serious reporting on this topic and sent us their findings as a part of NPR's Student Podcast Challenge.
item.dc:creator: Janet W. Lee

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and border czar Tom Homan begin talks over ICE surge
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan met with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz Tuesday. Homan takes over from Border Patrol Chief Greg Bovino, overseeing ICE operations in the state. Do things look any different on the ground?
item.content:encoded: Border czar Tom Homan met with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz Tuesday. Homan takes over from Border Patrol Chief Greg Bovino, overseeing ICE operations in the state. Do things look any different on the ground?
item.dc:creator: Brian Bakst

item.title: Winter is tough on people still living in RVs after Helene in Asheville, N.C.
item.description: In Asheville, N.C., hundreds of people still live in RV's 16 months after Hurricane Helene, and staying warm in freezing temperatures is a challenge.
item.content:encoded: In Asheville, N.C., hundreds of people still live in RV's 16 months after Hurricane Helene, and staying warm in freezing temperatures is a challenge.
item.dc:creator: Gerard Albert III

item.title: A CrossFit-like race is booming in Asia, and young people are driving the surge
item.description: Demand for fitness activities and new workout trends is surging across Asia, turning health and wellness into a multi-billion-dollar business.
item.content:encoded: Demand for fitness activities and new workout trends is surging across Asia, turning health and wellness into a multi-billion-dollar business.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Yang

item.title: EU signs 'mother of all deals' to boost trade with India
item.description: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.
item.content:encoded: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: 'KPop Demon Hunters' HUNTR/X conquer the charts and claim their destiny
item.description: The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.
item.content:encoded:
The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.

(Image credit: Lauren Crew for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: What Tom Homan's leadership might mean in Minneapolis
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Caitlin Dickerson of The Atlantic about Tom Homan's career in law enforcement, and what she thinks his arrival in Minneapolis will mean for the immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Caitlin Dickerson of The Atlantic about Tom Homan's career in law enforcement, and what she thinks his arrival in Minneapolis will mean for the immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino
